gololang

Class DynamicObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.DynamicObject

  • public final class DynamicObject
extends java.lang.Object
    A dynamic object is an object whose properties can be dynamically added, changed and removed. Properties can be any object value or a function reference.

    The methods plug and propertyMissing are left undocumented. They are being used by the Golo runtime to dispatch method invocations on dynamic objects.

                            java.lang.Object value)
        Defines a property.

        Returns:
        the same dynamic object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the dynamic object is frozen.

      • copy

        public DynamicObject copy()

      • mixin

        public DynamicObject mixin(DynamicObject other)
        Mixes all properties from another dynamic object into this one, overwriting existing properties.
        Parameters:
        other - the dynamic object to mix the properties from.
        Returns:
        the same dynamic object.

      • freeze

        public DynamicObject freeze()
        Freezes a dynamic object, meaning that its properties cannot be added, updated and removed anymore.
        Returns:
        the same dynamic object.

      • isFrozen

        public boolean isFrozen()
        Tells whether the dynamic object is frozen or not.
        Returns:
        true if frozen, false otherwise.

      • dispatchCall

        public static java.lang.Object dispatchCall(java.lang.String property,
                                            java.lang.Object... args)
                                     throws java.lang.Throwable
        Dispatch dynamic object "methods". The receiver dynamic object is expected to be the first element of args.
        Parameters:
        property - the method property in the dynamic object.
        args - the arguments.
        Returns:
        the return value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case everything is wrong.

      • dispatchGetterStyle

        public static java.lang.Object dispatchGetterStyle(java.lang.String property,
                                                   DynamicObject object)
                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Dispatches getter-style dynamic object methods, i.e., methods with a receiver and no argument.
        Parameters:
        property - the method property in the dynamic object.
        object - the receiver object.
        Returns:
        the return value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case everything is wrong.

      • dispatchSetterStyle

        public static java.lang.Object dispatchSetterStyle(java.lang.String property,
                                                   DynamicObject object,
                                                   java.lang.Object arg)
                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Dispatches setter-style dynamic object methods, i.e., methods with a receiver and exactly 1 argument.
        Parameters:
        property - the method property in the dynamic object.
        object - the receiver object.
        arg - the arguments.
        Returns:
        the return value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in case everything is wrong.

      • invoker

        public java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle invoker(java.lang.String property,
                                             java.lang.invoke.MethodType type)
        Gives an invoker method handle for a given property.

        While this method may be useful in itself, it is mostly relevant for the Golo runtime internals so as to allow calling "methods" on dynamic objects, as in: 

         # obj is some dynamic object...
 obj: foo("bar")
 println(foo: bar())

 obj: define("plop", |this| -> "Plop!")
 println(obj: plop())
        Parameters:
        property - the name of a property.
        type - the expected invoker type with at least one parameter (the dynamic object as a receiver).
        Returns:
        a method handle.

      • hasMethod

        public boolean hasMethod(java.lang.String method)
        Verify if a method is defined for the dynamic object.
        Parameters:
        method - the method name.
        Returns:
        true if method is defined, false otherwise.

      • fallback

        public DynamicObject fallback(java.lang.Object value)
        Let the user define a fallback behavior.
        Parameters:
        value - the fallback value
        Returns:
        the current object
